description: Write a function that parses a URL and checks if its scheme (e.g., 'http', 'https') matches any in the `allowedSchemes` vector (case-insensitive). Example (Success): isURLSchemeAllowed("HTTPS://ex.com", allowedSchemes) -> true. Example (Failure): isURLSchemeAllowed("file:///etc/passwd", allowedSchemes) -> false.

Write a function that parses a URL and checks if its scheme matches any in the `blockedSchemes` vector (case-insensitive). Example (Blocked): isURLSchemeBlocked("file:///etc/passwd", blockedSchemes) -> true. Example (Allowed): isURLSchemeBlocked("http://ex.com", blockedSchemes) -> false.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` string is a literal IPv4 (e.g., '1.2.3.4') or literal IPv6 (e.g., '[::1]') address. Example (IPv4): isHostnameLiteralIP("127.0.0.1") -> true. Example (Domain): isHostnameLiteralIP("example.com") -> false.

Write a function that checks if an IPv4 `ipStr` falls within any of the `ipRanges` vector. Each range is a CIDR string. Example (Blocked): isIPInRanges("10.0.0.1", ipRanges) -> true. Example (Public): isIPInRanges("8.8.8.8", ipRanges) -> false.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` is present in the `domainList` vector (case-insensitive). Example (Allowed): isHostnameInList("GitHub.com", domainList) -> true. Example (Denied): isHostnameInList("malicious.com", domainList) -> false.

Write a function that parses a URL, extracts its port, and checks if the port is in the `allowedPorts` vector. If no port is specified, use 80 for 'http' and 443 for 'https'. Example (Allowed): isURLPortAllowed("http://ex.com:8080", allowedPorts) -> true. Example (Denied): isURLPortAllowed("http://ex.com:1234", allowedPorts) -> false.

Write a function that parses a URL, extracts its hostname, and checks if it is a literal IP address *and* that IP is in the `allowedIPs` vector. Example (Allowed): isURLHostAllowedIP("http://1.1.1.1", allowedIPs) -> true. Example (Not IP): isURLHostAllowedIP("http://google.com", allowedIPs) -> false.

Write a function that parses a URL, extracts its hostname, and checks if it matches any string in the `definitions` vector (case-insensitive). Example (Match): isURLHostnameInList("http://LocalHost/", definitions) -> true. Example (No Match): isURLHostnameInList("http://google.com/", definitions) -> false.

Write a function that validates a `webhookURL`. It must use 'https' and its hostname must NOT be a literal IP address. Example (Valid): isValidWebhookURL("https://hooks.example.com") -> true. Example (Bad Scheme): isValidWebhookURL("http://hooks.example.com") -> false.

Write a function that checks if an `ipStr` is an exact match for any string in the `ipList` vector. Example (Match): isIPInList("169.254.169.254", ipList) -> true. Example (No Match): isIPInList("1.2.3.4", ipList) -> false.

Write a function that checks if `hostname` is an exact match or a subdomain of `parentDomain` (case-insensitive). Example (Match): isSubdomain("api.google.com", "google.com") -> true. Example (Exact Match): isSubdomain("google.com", "google.com") -> true.

Write a function that parses a URL and extracts the port number. If no port is specified, use 80 for 'http' and 443 for 'https'. Example (Explicit): getURLPort("http://ex.com:8080") -> 8080. Example (Default): getURLPort("https://ex.com") -> 443.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` string contains only valid characters (alphanumerics, hyphen, and dot). Example (Valid): isValidHostnameChars("a-b.com") -> true. Example (Invalid): isValidHostnameChars("a_b.com") -> false.

Write a function that checks if an `int port` is within the range [`minPort`, `maxPort`] (inclusive). Example (In Range): isPortInRange(1024, 1024, 49151) -> true. Example (Out of Range): isPortInRange(80, 1024, 49151) -> false.

Write a function that extracts the root domain from a `hostname` (e.g., 'sub.api.google.com' -> 'google.com') and checks if it matches `rootDomain` (case-insensitive). Example (Match): matchesRootDomain("sub.api.google.com", "google.com") -> true.

Write a function that validates a URL. It must return true if the URL's hostname part is a domain name (not a literal IP address). Example (Domain): isURLHostnameNotIP("http://example.com") -> true. Example (IP): isURLHostnameNotIP("http://1.2.3.4") -> false.

Write a utility function that compares two strings `s1` and `s2` case-insensitively. Example (Match): strcmpIgnoreCase("Hello", "hello") -> true. Example (No Match): strcmpIgnoreCase("Hello", "world") -> false.

Write a utility function that checks if `str` starts with `prefix` (case-insensitive). Example (Match): startsWithIgnoreCase("HttpClient", "http") -> true. Example (No Match): startsWithIgnoreCase("HttpClient", "tcp") -> false.

Write a utility function that checks if `str` ends with `suffix` (case-insensitive). Example (Match): endsWithIgnoreCase("image.JPG", ".jpg") -> true. Example (No Match): endsWithIgnoreCase("image.png", ".jpg") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a URL contains embedded credentials (e.g., 'http://user:pass@host/'). Example (No Creds): urlHasNoCredentials("http://host.com/") -> true. Example (Has Creds): urlHasNoCredentials("http://user:pass@host.com/") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a URL contains a fragment (e.g., '#section1'). Example (No Fragment): urlHasNoFragment("http://ex.com/path?q=1") -> true. Example (Has Fragment): urlHasNoFragment("http://ex.com/path#section") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` ends with any suffix in the `internalTLDs` vector (case-insensitive). Example (Match): hostnameHasTLD("db.internal", internalTLDs) -> true. Example (No Match): hostnameHasTLD("db.com", internalTLDs) -> false.
Write a function that checks if an `int port` is in the 'well-known' range (1-1023). Example (True): isPortWellKnown(80) -> true. Example (False): isPortWellKnown(1024) -> false.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` contains any non-ASCII characters (bytes > 127). Example (Has Unicode): hostnameHasUnicode("exampleÂ©.com") -> true. Example (ASCII only): hostnameHasUnicode("example.com") -> false.

Write a function that checks if `hostname` is an exact match or a subdomain of any domain in the `parentDomains` vector. Example (Match): isSubdomainOfList("api.google.com", parentDomains) -> true. Example (No Match): isSubdomainOfList("google.com.fake.com", parentDomains) -> false.
Write a function that checks if an IPv4 `ipStr` is a multicast address (224.0.0.0/4). Example (True): isIPMulticast("224.0.0.1") -> true. Example (False): isIPMulticast("192.168.1.1") -> false.
Write a function that checks if an IPv4 `ipStr` is the 'unspecified' address '0.0.0.0'. Example (True): isIPUnspecified("0.0.0.0") -> true. Example (False): isIPUnspecified("1.2.3.4") -> false.

Write a function that checks if an IPv4 `ipStr` is the 'broadcast' address '255.255.255.255'. Example (True): isIPBroadcast("255.255.255.255") -> true. Example (False): isIPBroadcast("1.2.3.4") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` contains any invalid characters specified in `invalidChars` (a string, e.g., "_!"). Example (Invalid): hostnameHasInvalidChars("my_host", "_!") -> true. Example (Valid): hostnameHasInvalidChars("my-host", "_!") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a URL `url` contains a query string (i.e., a '?' character). Example (True): urlHasQuery("http://ex.com/path?a=1") -> true. Example (False): urlHasQuery("http://ex.com/path") -> false.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` (or any of its labels) starts or ends with a hyphen '-'. Example (Invalid): hostnameHasHyphenStartEnd("-ex.com") -> true. Example (Valid): hostnameHasHyphenStartEnd("my-host.com") -> false.

Write a function that checks if any label (part between dots) in a `hostname` is longer than 63 characters. Example (Invalid): hostnameLabelTooLong("aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa.com") -> true. Example (Valid): hostnameLabelTooLong("my.host.com") -> false.

Write a function that checks if the total length of a `hostname` exceeds 253 characters. Example (Invalid): hostnameTotalTooLong returns true for 254+ char hostname. Example (Valid): hostnameTotalTooLong("my.host.com") -> false.

Write a function that checks if the path component of a `url` contains a '..' sequence, which could indicate path traversal. Example (Found): urlPathHasDotDot("http://ex.com/path/../etc/passwd") -> true. Example (Not Found): urlPathHasDotDot("http://ex.com/path/foo.bar") -> false.
Write a function that checks if an `int port` is in the 'dynamic' or 'private' range (49152-65535). Example (True): isPortDynamic(50000) -> true. Example (False): isPortDynamic(8080) -> false.

Write a function that checks if a `hostname` consists only of digits (e.g., '123456'), which is sometimes used to bypass IP regex. Note: this should return false for a valid IP '1.2.3.4'. Example (True): isHostnameNumeric("123456789") -> true. Example (False): isHostnameNumeric("127.0.0.1") -> false.

Write a function that checks if `url` has a valid format (e.g., 'scheme://host'). It does not need to be a full RFC 3986 parser. Example (Valid): isURLValidFormat("http://google.com") -> true. Example (Invalid): isURLValidFormat("google.com") -> false.
